alert.note: Alert for Coastal Bryan; Coastal Chatham; Inland Bryan; Inland Chatham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 2:57PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BRYAN AND CHATHAM COUNTIES... At 257 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Burroughs, or over Richmond Hill, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph and up to penny sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Richmond Hill, Hunter Army Airfield, Midtown Savannah, Coffee Bluff, Montgomery, Vernonburg, Fort Mcallister, and Sandfly. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Bryan; Coastal Chatham; Inland Bryan; Inland Chatham
